options.label: Offshore wind
options.description: For example, turbines in the sea or fresh water used to harvest wind energy to generate electricity.

options.label: Hydropower
options.description: For example, generation of electricity from hydroelectric dams. Exclude tidal or wave power.

options.label: Other renewable electricity
options.description: Electricity generated from, for example, wave, tidal or geothermal renewable sources. Exclude the generation of heat from geothermal means.

options.label: Bioenergy
options.description: For example, the production of liquid biofuels from biomass sources such as peanut or vegetable oil.

options.label: Alternative fuels
options.description: For example, hydrogen produced by electrolysis or low carbon thermochemical processes, alcohol fuels, or carbon-neutral synthetic fuels.

options.label: Renewable heat
options.description: For example, ground, air, water or hybrid heat pumps, waste heat recovery, geothermal, solar thermal or heat networks that use renewable heat sources.

options.label: Renewable combined heat and power

options.label: Energy efficient lighting
options.description: For example, energy efficient bulbs, tubes, fittings or controls.

options.label: Energy efficient products
options.description: For example, energy efficient doors and windows (double glazing) or heating and ventilation products such as condensing boilers.

options.label: Energy monitoring, saving or control systems

options.description: For example, systems that reduce energy consumption through effective heat or electricity management.

options.label: Low carbon consultancy, advisory and offsetting services

options.description: Expert advice, training or education on, for example, reducing carbon consumption or engaging in low carbon industrial activities.

options.label: Low emission vehicles and infrastructure
options.description: Vehicles and systems with specific technology to significantly reduce or remove emissions for example, hybrid, plug-in hybrid, or battery electric vehicles, and electric vehicle charging points.

options.label: Carbon capture and storage
options.description: For example, the capture of waste carbon-dioxide or other greenhouse gases, either at the point of emission or from the atmosphere.

options.label: Nuclear power
options.description: For example, light water, fast breeder, or thermal breeder, reactors.

options.label: Fuel cells and energy storage systems

options.description: Conversion of energy into a form which can be stored. And the storing, and subsequent use, of that energy. For example, batteries.
